maptool.urbs_results.routes

Functions

urbs_results_setup()

called when the urbs results window is first opened

urbs_resultsNetwork()

on opening of the urbs results view the js code requests full information of the previously selected network

aggregate function for determining plotting behaviour. The names of the nodes of a given feature are extracted here before calling
maptool.urbs_results.routes.urbs_results_setup()

called when the urbs results window is first opened finds the last changed directory in the urbs results directory, which we can assume to be the directory that has the results of our urbs run

Returns:

path to the html file for the current window

Return type:

string

maptool.urbs_results.routes.urbs_resultsNetwork()

on opening of the urbs results view the js code requests full information of the previously selected network we return the network with previously chosen and session-dependant plz, kcid and bcid with all features

Returns:

a json filled with geoJSON featureCollections created from the network selected in previous steps

Return type:

dict

maptool.urbs_results.routes.urbs_results_generate_plot()

aggregate function for determining plotting behaviour. The names of the nodes of a given feature are extracted here before calling whatever plotting functions the user has defined in urbs_results_plotting.py. The html files returned by the plotting functions are turned into strings and sent to the frontend

Returns:

a json containing all html plots for a feature as strings

Return type:

json dict
